summary: The A/B test was conducted on two variants:C and T. The impact on each metric is summarized below.

key_metrics.interpretation: Variant T performs worse with  only 14.3% probability of uplift in sales value.
Variant T performs worse with  only 13.87% probability of uplift in units sold.

Conversion rate is the number of customers making at least 1 purchase out of all the customers exposedto the treatment. Variant T performs worse with  only 13.88% probability of uplift in conversion  rate.
Variant T performs worse with  only 13.87% probability of uplift in units sold.

recommendations: Do  not implement the treatment version as it shows significant degradations in all  the  metrics
limitations: Sample size may not be large enough to detect smaller effects
The test doesn't account for potential seasonal variations
Long-term effects on customer retention are not measured in this analysis
